Class AddAppointmentScreenController

  • java.lang.Object
    • Controllers.AddAppointmentScreenController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class AddAppointmentScreenController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    This is the class for the screen that you can add an appointment with and the controller

      • populateControlArrayLists

        public void populateControlArrayLists()
        This method populates the array lists containing all of the text boxes, combo boxes, etc. Used in order to do error checks

      • populateContactList

        public void populateContactList()
        This method populates the contact information in the add appointment screen.

        Lambda expression: The lambda expression used is to cycle through each contact in our list and them add that contact to the combo box. Used in place of a for loop. This is utilized as it simplifies how the code appears to the developer in one line. This is much more accessible to understand to anyone viewing the code who is new to it.

      • populateDateComboBoxes

        public void populateDateComboBoxes()
        This method populates the information for the date combo boxes

        public void populateHourMinuteComboBox()
        This method populates the hours/minutes/am or pm combo boxes

      • validateDateTimeInput

        public boolean validateDateTimeInput()
        This method validates the date and time inputs for any errors, false if error detected, true if no error detected
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean representing if any errors detected. True = error detected, false = no error detected
